bibl.title: Despatch from Henry May, December 21, 1866
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

correspDesc.correspAction: Late U.S. Consul Agent Washington, D.C. <date when="1866-12-25"

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
<pb facs="20170615_113526"
Sir,
Your
communication of the sixth in >uncertain
the 14t has been received. I am requesting to inform the Department why my request sent of office was not presented previously*
I wrote to the Department while in Africa in regard the time of Office and recieved for answers that would *unclear and forward to the Department a officials signed by the respects to the effect that entails an office and said Office by vessels for Governement purposes one for no other. That accept such a certificate the Department would inform me of its decision. I immmediately forwarded Gordon + Bumma certifying to the above facts also certifyinh that in their judgement the rest of said Officers was over five hundred and fifty dollars per ammunition of more received any be the certificate. I delayed writing again in regard to this matter not wishing to call attention again to the *unclear it supposed was already under consideration.
This liked to be press the claim after once fairly presenting it at a time when it seemed to be one you must have so much of greater importance to occupy your mention Another resaon too was the diffculty *unclear* in that for off out of the way country in putting drafts cashed without paying such extreme taxes of exhange + then perhaps not at all.
The above are the plants of unsaid <pb facs="20170615_113529" Why I did not present greatly accounts of collect not Faculty for by Office. I am quite sure I want nothing but what is just and honorable in the nature.
Your Communication stated that my account cannot be allowed until *unclear* vouched and furnished the Department. The muchin before refered to as having you signed by Nupris Poulvre +Bamma I think must have been received by the Department if so please inform me as soon the *unclear* as necessary. If Baked make was not received please inform me; and I would next unexpectedly request your indulgence in this matter as I have no dates of communicaitons within which in Africa/
I am Sir with the highest Consideration Your most humble + obident Servant Henry May Late U.S. Comml. Agt. And or Arnus Lotovy County L'ovre December 21st,1866
